HW14_DOC repository Accounts¶

async src.repository.accounts.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Sets the confirmed field of a user to True

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user

  • db (Session) – Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Creates new account

  • db (Session) – Session

New account

  • db (Session) – DB session

async src.repository.accounts.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session)¶

Updates the avatar of a user

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Find the user in the database

  • url (str) – New avatar URL

  • db (Session) – Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

Return type:

Account

Update token for account

Parameters:

  • login (Account) – Account

  • token (str or None) – new token or None

  • db (Session) – Session

HW14_DOC repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, current_user: Account, db: Session)¶

Creates a new user for current Account

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – Get the data from the request body

  • current_user (Account) – Get the current user that is logged in

  • db (Session) – DB session

Returns:

New user

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.find_user(user_name: str, user_surname: str, user_email: str, account: Account, db: Session)¶

Finds a user by their first name, last name, and email address for the specified account

Parameters:

  • user_name (str) – Filter the query by user name

  • user_surname (str) – sFilter the users by surname

  • user_email (str) – Filter the query by email

  • account (Account) – User account

  • db (Session) – DB session

Returns:

The first user found in the database with the given parameters

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user(user_id: int, account: Account, db: Session)¶

Returns a user object from the database.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – int: User ID

  • account (Account) – User account

  • db (Session) – DB session

Returns:

A user object

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_users(skip: int, limit: int, account: Account, db: Session)¶

Returns a list of users from the database.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – Skip the first n users in the database

  • limit (int) – Limit the number of users returned

  • account (Account) – User account

  • db (Session) – DB session

Returns:

A list of user objects

Return type:

list[User]

async src.repository.users.remove_user(user_id: int, account: Account, db: Session)¶

Removes a user from the database.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – Identify the user to be removed

  • account (Account) – User account

  • db (Session) – DB session

Returns:

Removed user object or None (if user not exist)

Return type:

User or None

async src.repository.users.upcoming_birthdays(db: Session, account: Account, days: int = 7)¶

Returns a list of users whose birthdays are within the next 7 days

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – DB session

  • account (Account) – User account

  • days (int) – Determine how many days in the future to look for upcoming birthdays

Returns:

A list of users

Return type:

list[User]

async src.repository.users.update_user(user_id: int, body: UserUpdate, account: Account, db: Session)¶

Updates a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – Identify the user to be updated

  • body (UserUpdate) – Updated user’s data

  • account (Account) – User account

  • db (Session) – DB session

Returns:

Updated user object or None (if user not exist)

Return type:

User or None

class src.schemas.AccountDb(*, id: int, login: str, email: str, avatar: str)¶

Bases: BaseModel

Represents a model for account database data.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – The account’s ID.

  • login (str) – The account’s login username.

  • email (str) – The account’s email address.

  • avatar (str) – The URL of the account’s avatar image.

class src.schemas.UserModel(*, name: str, surname: str = None, email: EmailStr, phone: str, birthdate: date, additional_data: str = None)¶

Bases: BaseModel

Represents a model for user data.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The user’s first name.

  • surname (str, optional) – The user’s last name.

  • email (EmailStr) – The user’s email address.

  • phone (str) – The user’s phone number.

  • birthdate (date) – The user’s date of birth.

  • additional_data (str, optional) – Additional data about the user.

class src.schemas.UserResponse(*, id: int, name: str, surname: str | None, email: EmailStr, phone: str, birthdate: date, additional_data: str | None)¶

Bases: BaseModel

Represents a model for user response data.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – The user’s ID.

  • name (str) – The user’s first name.

  • surname (str, optional) – The user’s last name.

  • email (EmailStr) – The user’s email address.

  • phone (str) – The user’s phone number.

  • birthdate (date) – The user’s date of birth.

  • additional_data (str, optional) – Additional data about the user.
